alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 10:41AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...The winter storm warning has expired. Heavy snow possible late tonight through Friday. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches possible. * WHERE...Osburn, Lookout Pass, Dobson Pass, Kellogg, Fourth Of July Pass, Pinehurst, St. Maries, Wallace, Fernwood, and Mullan. * WHEN...From late tonight through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday and Friday commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For Thursday and Friday, an Arctic front tracking into North Idaho Thursday night and Friday will bring gusty northeast winds with areas of blowing and drifting snow and much colder temperatures.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
